item.title: I thought I was being kidnapped during arrest - Maguire
item.description: Manchester United's Harry Maguire says he feared for his life when Greek police arrested him last week.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Reassuring' study of children's 'tiny' risk
item.description: Severe Covid-19 is rare and dying from it exceptionally rare, a study of UK hospital data finds.

item.title: Heads tell pupils and parents: 'We are ready for you'
item.description: Head teachers seek to reassure parents they are ready to welcome all classes back.

item.title: Kyle Rittenhouse charged over Wisconsin protest deaths
item.description: Kyle Rittenhouse is charged with killing two people and injuring another amid protests in Kenosha.

item.title: EastEnders recruits real-life partners for 'intimate' scenes
item.description: The cast's real-life partners are being recruited as body doubles to enable safe filming.

item.title: Coronavirus: New virus hotspots emerge in Australia
item.description: Public health alerts are issued in Sydney amid a cluster of cases believed to be linked to gyms.

item.title: Scrapping 213 local councils could save Â£3bn says report
item.description: It comes as the government prepares to publish plans on overhauling the local government system.

item.title: Scientists target coronavirus immunity puzzle
item.description: There's to be a new effort to understand how the immune system responds to Covid-19.

item.title: Switzerland and Czech Republic added to quarantine list
item.description: Travellers in Switzerland, Jamaica and Czech Republic must quarantine on return from Saturday.

item.title: Hurricane Laura's winds batter Louisiana, killing six
item.description: Flooding is less than feared, but Governor John Bel Edwards warned people to stay vigilant.

item.title: Coronavirus: Pair escorted from flight after positive test text
item.description: The pair were about to fly to Italy when one of them learned he had tested positive for coronavirus.

item.title: Yaser Abdel Said: Suspect on FBI most-wanted list arrested
item.description: Yaser Abdel Said is arrested 12 years after the New Year's Day shootings of his daughters in Texas.

item.title: The Papers: 'Secret' care deaths and UK ushered back to office
item.description: Claims that virus death tolls in care homes are not being disclosed feature on Friday's front pages.

item.title: Quiz of the week: How did Lionel Messi tell Barcelona he wanted out?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: The Archers: Radio 4 soap returns to the studio after lockdown criticism
item.description: Radio 4's soap is back in the studio, after criticisms of the show's lockdown episodes.

item.title: I'm A Celebrity: ITV confirm show will moves to Gwrych Castle in Wales
item.description: This year's winner will be crowned the King or Queen of the Castle (instead of the Jungle).

item.title: Ian Wright hits back at 'racially driven' abuse
item.description: After Sky Sports decided to remove three pundits from Soccer Saturday, racial abuse appeared online.

item.title: Everything Everything: The kings of bizarre DIY music videos
item.description: Everything Everything say it's love, not money, that makes a good video.

item.title: Swanage RNLI lifeboat rescue recreated by 11-year-old animator
item.description: The animation about a Swanage lifeboat launch has been viewed more than 100,000 times.

item.title: Katy Perry and Orlando Bloom announce birth of first child Daisy Dove Bloom
item.description: The couple said they were "floating with love and wonder" after the arrival of Daisy Dove Bloom.

item.title: Coronavirus: The pictures that create more empathy than words
item.description: A series of artworks reveal what it is like to be in lockdown and managing an invisible illness.

item.title: Kyle Rittenhouse: Who is US teen accused of Kenosha Wisconsin protest murders?
item.description: The suspect fired his gun on a night when armed militias clashed with Black Lives Matter protests.

item.title: Caged Congolese teen: Why a zoo took 114 years to apologise
item.description: Ota Benga was kidnapped from what is now DR Congo in 1904 and taken to the US to be exhibited.

item.title: Harry Dunn death: Mum vows to keep promise to get son justice
item.description: Harry Dunn's mother Charlotte Charles will keep fighting to bring the suspect before a UK court.

item.title: 'Mum died of cancer - now I must care for my brother'
item.description: Sarah Thomas cared for her terminally ill mum and has now taken on responsibility for her brother.

item.title: Coronavirus: Vaccine front-runner China already inoculating workers
item.description: Chinese health officials say they used emergency powers to secretly test unapproved vaccines.

item.title: Flu: Why we still need to worry about it this winter
item.description: Drive-through vaccination clinics and extra staff are being considered for England's biggest flu vaccination programme.

item.title: Richard Osman: 'I wish I were cooler but I'm not'
item.description: The Pointless star on loving both the mainstream and the offbeat - and bringing both to his new book.

item.title: The 'selfish waster' who now runs a monastery
item.description: How a rebellious young man from Tibet ended up as abbot of a Buddhist centre in southern Scotland.

item.title: More US sports events postponed in protest at Jacob Blake shooting
item.description: A host of US sports games were postponed for a second straight day in protest at the shooting of Jacob Blake.

item.title: Murray to play Nishioka & Konta faces Watson at US Open
item.description: Britain's Andy Murray will play Japan's Yoshihito Nishioka in the US Open first round, while Johanna Konta and Heather Watson meet in an all-British match.

item.title: Man Utd midfielder Pogba tests positive for coronavirus
item.description: Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba tests positive for coronavirus, says France manager Didier Deschamps.

item.title: Belgian GP: Lewis Hamilton rules out race boycott
item.description: World champion Lewis Hamilton backs US sports stars boycotting events to fight racism but does not believe missing the Belgium GP would have an effect.

item.title: Messi contacted Guardiola before Barca transfer request - Friday's gossip
item.description: Lionel Messi tipped off Pep Guardiola over transfer request, Real put price tag on Serge Reguilon, Chelsea set to complete Kai Havertz deal, plus more.

item.title: Lionel Messi's top five World Cup goals for Argentina
item.description: Watch Lionel Messi's best goals for Argentina at the World Cup, including a 'magnificent' last-minute winner against Iran in 2014.

item.title: Fan Tales: The Pakistan super fan who's 'living the dream' following his team
item.description: In the latest episode in our Fan Tales series, we meet a Pakistan super fan who's desperate for his country's cricket fans stand out.

item.title: UK travel restrictions: Are Greece and Turkey on the quarantine list?
item.description: Key holiday spots are being regularly added to the travel quarantine list as infection rates rise.

item.title: Coronavirus: Does my child have to return to school?
item.description: Parents are being urged to send their children back to school for the autumn term

item.title: Coronavirus: How can I find a new job?
item.description: Jobseekers are having a tough time at the moment but some sectors are hiring and support is available.

item.title: Coronavirus in the UK: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: Good ventilation could be key to avoiding coronavirus this autumn as people spend more time indoors.

item.title: Coronavirus: How will deaf schoolchildren cope with face coverings? And other questions
item.description: Local lockdowns are in force in England, but what are the rules? We answer some of your questions.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can I work from home overseas?
item.description: Thinking about setting up a home office abroad? Here's what you need to know.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules for face masks or face coverings?
item.description: The guidance on who should wear face coverings varies around the UK.

item.title: Coronavirus: When does the 'eat out to help out scheme' end?
item.description: Thousands of venues have taken part in a discounting scheme to help boost the hospitality industry.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK travel quarantine rules?
item.description: France and the Netherlands are the latest places from where people must quarantine on arriving in the UK.

item.title: Coronavirus: Are teachers more at risk of coronavirus?
item.description: Children are at low risk from the disease, but concerns have been raised for teachers.

item.title: Coronavirus: How are other countries getting children back to class?
item.description: Children are starting a new school year across Europe. What measures are being put in place?

item.title: Coronavirus: What tests are available?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: BTec Nationals and Firsts: What went wrong with the grades?
item.description: The BTec First grades have been delayed. What caused the problems with the results?

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Teams around the world are looking into medicines for Covid-19 and scientists are starting to discover what works.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does Covid-19 test-and-trace work?
item.description: People who have been in close contact with someone found to have Covid-19 are now being traced.

item.title: Europe lockdown: New coronavirus rules country by country
item.description: What are European countries doing to control new coronavirus outbreaks?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules around evictions?
item.description: The ban on evictions has been extended, but how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the risks of catching it from food packaging?
item.description: Some cases around the world have been linked to packaging on frozen food.
